team: Prof. Ahmad Esmaili | CSE214 - Data Structures

details.title: Responsibilities
details.description: Hosting office hours, hosting recitations, grading assignments and exam papers.

details.title: Tutoring
details.description: Tutored several students over Zoom. Courses ranged from Object Oriented Programming to Design Patterns in Java.

details.title: Country Factbook Scraper
details.description: The only major freelance undertaking. Wrote a node.js based library to scrape CIA's World Factbook.

details.title: NLU Grammars for Alexa Money Domain use-cases
details.description: Created Natural Language Understanding grammars for several Alexa Money Domain projects. Got training for, and used an Alexa-internal Domain Specific Language.

details.title: Political Donations using Alexa
details.description: Worked on the NLU and Java backend components for enabling donations to US 2020 presidential election candidates. This enabled users to make donations to their favourite candidate using their Alexa device. Worked on making the involved systems compliant with US Federal and state laws.

details.title: Amazon Pay components on the Alexa mobile app
details.description: Implemented Amazon Pay's UI elements on the Alexa mobile app on Android and iOS. Used the React Native framework and TypeScript. Performed testing using Android Studio and XCode.

details.title: Merchant Payments using Alexa
details.description: Worked on enabling the Alexa payments platform in Europe and Japan regions.

details.title: Data Migration Pipeline
details.description: Created a data migration pipeline that would facilitate the backfilling of millions of entries of historical transaction data from an Amazon-internal database platform to AWS DynamoDB. At the end of this internship, I was awarded a pre-placement offer for returning to work full-time for Amazon after graduating.
